definitions: To be present while something is happening, but not do anything to stop it.
To be ready to do something or to help someone.
To continue to support someone or something, especially when they are being criticized.
To be loyal to someone or something.
To be available and ready for use.
To adhere to a promise or agreement.
examples: He just stood by and watched her get robbed.
The emergency services are standing by in case of a major incident.
I will stand by my friend no matter what.
The company stood by its decision despite public outcry.
The backup generators are standing by.
We will stand by our original agreement.
